content.description: This is the big obvious white slab with a big roof,  visible up high and left as you drive up canyon. great sunny route. warm in the winter.
content.location: drive up canyon just past white line and park at a turn around at the toe of the buttress. From the parking spot, walk over to the toe and then hike brushy ledges left  (then cut back right up top) or head right to the back of the wash and up brushy ledges on the left; or rope up and climb up climbalicious. from there, a short scramble leeds to the base of the the climb. it's also possible (and perhaps better) to climb funktastic to get to white line. bolt anchors.

content.description: way fun climb. great moves on good edges. a little bit run out but not desperate. shares the anchor with Funtastic.
content.protection: one optional medium stopper (or cam) for the start; 4 quickdraws for the remainder.

content.description: Climb the right or left side of the pillar (both go at 5.7) and continue up passing 3 bolts to a bomber 2 bolt anchor. a little bit run but very well protected. fun climb in a beautiful secluded canyon, yet close to town.
content.protection: single rack for the start and quickdraws for the upper section.
content.location: 40 feet left of Funktastic there's a 25 foot pillar with brush at the base.

climbs.name: Funktastic
climbs.fa: Paul Bucher, Drake Buckingham, Roger Hedlund

content.description: great mix of face and crack climbing with climatic final moves over a roof. possible to hike in and top rope. fantastic route with a  crux start and finish. pitch 1 goes at 5.10 and quickly eases up. pitch 2 goes at 5.10++D.
content.protection: singles to a #4 camalot. 4 quickdraws. one cam in between a 2 and 3 camalot size.  suggest extra #3 for the roof. bomber 2 bolt anchor on top of pitch 1. big slung tree on pitch 2.
content.location: park as for white line and climbalicious. hike about 50 yards left of said routes. route starts up a small pedestal by some large boulders laid out like a backwards F. the route starts directly below the big bagel looking butt crack with an obvious crack through the roof.

content.description: Somebody call a doctor, cuz i got a bad case of Boogie Fever. super fun route. nice little pocket down and right to pro up for the belayer. looks run to the first bolt but is not. it's possible to get three pieces below it. a tiny (not obvious from the deck) piece protects the crux move below the bolt. another "hidden" tiny piece protects the second crux move above (the step into the corner) then it's cake to the top. possible to rap down right to set top rope on routes to the right. Absolutely Great Average Joe route.
content.protection: double small to tiny then single rack to optional three inch, three quick draws (for the three bolts), one optional runner. at least one small to tiny is mandatory. No stoppers or hexes. bomber two bolt anchor.
content.location: the left most route on the wall. starts up right of a split boulder and left of the Funtastic pillar. rap or lower down.

climbs.name: Climbalicious
climbs.fa: Paul Bucher, Roger Hedlund, Drake Buckingham

content.description: fun little mix of face and crack climbing. a tad run but well protected. start below white line fever near some small trees. head up a slab/seem to a bolt at the base of a jumble. cut right and up on tiny gear (and/or stoppers) to another bolt and on to better gear. save a small gray camalot for the top out moves. can be top roped by hiking around left or right. nice access pitch to white line fever. excellent south facing full fun in the sun.
content.protection: single rack up to a # 2 camalot. 2 quick draws. optional extra small stuff or stoppers. bomber 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: park just past white line fever at a turn around at the toe of the buttress. hike the toe to the base of the climb. 5 minutes. hike to a point directly below white line fever. white line is easy to identify. striking white slab with a huge roof.
